                        <item>
            <title><![CDATA[U.S. military airlifts small reactor for the first time as Trump pushes to quickly deploy nuclear power]]></title>
            <link>https://www.pbs.org/newshour/nation/u-s-military-airlifts-small-reactor-for-the-first-time-as-trump-pushes-to-quickly-deploy-nuclear-power</link>
            <description><![CDATA[The Pentagon and the Energy Department for the first time airlifted a small nuclear reactor from California to Utah, demonstrating what they say is the U.S. potential to quickly deploy nuclear power for military and civilian use.]]></description>
            <pubDate>Sat, 21 Feb 2026 14:47:55 -0500</pubDate>
            <guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.pbs.org/newshour/nation/u-s-military-airlifts-small-reactor-for-the-first-time-as-trump-pushes-to-quickly-deploy-nuclear-power</guid>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/department-of-energy"><![CDATA[department of energy]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/nuclear-energy"><![CDATA[nuclear energy]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/nuclear-power"><![CDATA[Nuclear Power]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/pentagon"><![CDATA[pentagon]]></category>
                                                        <dc:creator><![CDATA[Matthew Daly, Associated Press]]></dc:creator>
                                                                <media:content url="https://d3i6fh83elv35t.cloudfront.net/static/2026/02/2026-02-16T050630Z_1778025587_RC2KMJA61UYD_RTRMADP_3_USA-MILITARY-NUCLEAR-MICROREACTOR-1024x676.jpg" medium="image" width="1024" height="676" />
                    </item>
                <item>
            <title><![CDATA[Hungary's foreign minister says country will block key EU loan to Ukraine until Russian oil shipments resume]]></title>
            <link>https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/hungarys-foreign-minister-says-country-will-block-key-eu-loan-to-ukraine-until-russian-oil-shipments-resume</link>
            <description><![CDATA[Hungary will block a planned 90-billion-euro ($106-billion) European Union loan to Ukraine until the flow of Russian oil through the Druzhba pipeline resumes, Hungary's foreign minister said.]]></description>
            <pubDate>Sat, 21 Feb 2026 14:28:24 -0500</pubDate>
            <guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/hungarys-foreign-minister-says-country-will-block-key-eu-loan-to-ukraine-until-russian-oil-shipments-resume</guid>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/hungary"><![CDATA[hungary]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/peter-szijjarto"><![CDATA[Péter Szijjártó]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/russia"><![CDATA[russia]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/ukraine"><![CDATA[Ukraine]]></category>
                                                        <dc:creator><![CDATA[Justin Spike, Associated Press]]></dc:creator>
                                                                <media:content url="https://d3i6fh83elv35t.cloudfront.net/static/2026/02/2025-10-15T074309Z_906292854_RC26CHAK17WV_RTRMADP_3_RUSSIA-ENERGY-1024x689.jpg" medium="image" width="1024" height="689" />
                    </item>
                <item>
            <title><![CDATA[Former UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson calls on allies to send noncombat troops to Ukraine]]></title>
            <link>https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/former-uk-prime-minister-boris-johnson-calls-on-allies-to-send-noncombat-troops-to-ukraine</link>
            <description><![CDATA[Former British Prime Minister Boris Johnson says the U.K. and its European allies should immediately deploy noncombat troops to Ukraine to show Vladimir Putin that Western nations are committed to the nation's freedom and independence.]]></description>
            <pubDate>Sat, 21 Feb 2026 13:40:06 -0500</pubDate>
            <guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/former-uk-prime-minister-boris-johnson-calls-on-allies-to-send-noncombat-troops-to-ukraine</guid>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/boris-johnson"><![CDATA[boris johnson]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/russia"><![CDATA[russia]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/ukraine"><![CDATA[Ukraine]]></category>
                                                        <dc:creator><![CDATA[Danica Kirka, Associated Press]]></dc:creator>
                                                                <media:content url="https://d3i6fh83elv35t.cloudfront.net/static/2022/06/johnson-1024x683.jpg" medium="image" width="1024" height="683" />
                    </item>
                <item>
            <title><![CDATA[President Trump increases global tariffs to 15% after Supreme Court decision]]></title>
            <link>https://www.pbs.org/newshour/economy/president-trump-increases-global-tariffs-to-15-after-supreme-court-decision</link>
            <description><![CDATA[President Donald Trump said Saturday that he was raising the global tariff he wants to impose to 15%, up from 10% he had announced a day earlier.]]></description>
            <pubDate>Sat, 21 Feb 2026 12:46:24 -0500</pubDate>
            <guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.pbs.org/newshour/economy/president-trump-increases-global-tariffs-to-15-after-supreme-court-decision</guid>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/donald-trump"><![CDATA[Donald Trump news]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/supreme-court"><![CDATA[Supreme Court]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/tariffs"><![CDATA[tariffs]]></category>
                                                        <dc:creator><![CDATA[Michelle L. Price, Associated Press]]></dc:creator>
                                                                <media:content url="https://d3i6fh83elv35t.cloudfront.net/static/2026/02/2026-02-20T192450Z_2041797055_RC2TPJA5LPB4_RTRMADP_3_USA-TRUMP-1024x683.jpg" medium="image" width="1024" height="683" />
                    </item>
                <item>
            <title><![CDATA[Fact-checking DHS Secretary Kristi Noem on her agency's role in elections]]></title>
            <link>https://www.pbs.org/newshour/politics/fact-checking-dhs-secretary-kristi-noem-on-her-agencys-role-in-elections</link>
            <description><![CDATA[Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem made comments that could lead people to misinterpret her agency's role in elections as she lobbied for legislation that would require photo ID to vote and documentary proof of citizenship for voter registration.]]></description>
            <pubDate>Sat, 21 Feb 2026 12:31:50 -0500</pubDate>
            <guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.pbs.org/newshour/politics/fact-checking-dhs-secretary-kristi-noem-on-her-agencys-role-in-elections</guid>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/Department-of-Homeland-Security"><![CDATA[Department of Homeland Security]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/elections"><![CDATA[elections]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/kristi-noem"><![CDATA[Kristi Noem]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/politifact"><![CDATA[politifact]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/voting"><![CDATA[voting]]></category>
                                                        <dc:creator><![CDATA[Amy Sherman, PolitiFact]]></dc:creator>
                                                                <media:content url="https://d3i6fh83elv35t.cloudfront.net/static/2026/02/2026-02-13T184610Z_67277476_RC26LJA9MMUK_RTRMADP_3_USA-ELECTION-NOEM-1024x683.jpg" medium="image" width="1024" height="683" />
                    </item>
                <item>
            <title><![CDATA[How organizers of the 2026 Winter Games made clean energy a priority]]></title>
            <link>https://www.pbs.org/newshour/science/how-organizers-of-the-2026-winter-games-made-clean-energy-a-priority</link>
            <description><![CDATA[Organizers of the 2026 Milan Cortina Games pledged that virtually all of the electricity to power the Winter Olympics would be clean.]]></description>
            <pubDate>Sat, 21 Feb 2026 11:36:59 -0500</pubDate>
            <guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.pbs.org/newshour/science/how-organizers-of-the-2026-winter-games-made-clean-energy-a-priority</guid>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/2026-olympics"><![CDATA[2026 olympics]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/2026-winter-olympics"><![CDATA[2026 winter olympics]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/clean-energy"><![CDATA[clean energy]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/milan-cortina-olympics"><![CDATA[Milan Cortina Olympics]]></category>
                                                        <dc:creator><![CDATA[Jennifer McDermott, Associated Press]]></dc:creator>
                                                                <media:content url="https://d3i6fh83elv35t.cloudfront.net/static/2026/02/2026-02-20T203955Z_1437211844_UP1EM2K1LEJMU_RTRMADP_3_OLYMPICS-2026-ICEHOCKEY-1024x683.jpg" medium="image" width="1024" height="683" />
                    </item>
                <item>
            <title><![CDATA[5 European allies pledge millions to build cheap drone defenses with Ukrainian know-how]]></title>
            <link>https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/5-european-allies-pledge-millions-to-build-cheap-drone-defenses-with-ukrainian-know-how</link>
            <description><![CDATA[Five European nations have announced a new program to produce low-cost air defense systems and autonomous drones using Ukrainian expertise hard-won over the past four years of war against Russia.]]></description>
            <pubDate>Fri, 20 Feb 2026 19:46:34 -0500</pubDate>
            <guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/5-european-allies-pledge-millions-to-build-cheap-drone-defenses-with-ukrainian-know-how</guid>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/drone-warfare"><![CDATA[Drone Warfare]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/drones"><![CDATA[Drones]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/europe"><![CDATA[europe]]></category>
                                                        <dc:creator><![CDATA[Sam McNeil, Associated Press]]></dc:creator>
                                <dc:creator><![CDATA[Claudia Ciobanu, Associated Press]]></dc:creator>
                                                                <media:content url="https://d3i6fh83elv35t.cloudfront.net/static/2026/02/2026-02-19T150854Z_1486228135_RC20PJAWCJY6_RTRMADP_3_GERMANY-NATO-STEADFAST-DART-26-1024x683.jpg" medium="image" width="1024" height="683" />
                    </item>
                <item>
            <title><![CDATA[Why the Supreme Court ruled against Trump's tariffs]]></title>
            <link>https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/why-the-supreme-court-ruled-against-trumps-tariffs</link>
            <description><![CDATA[The Supreme Court struck down most of President Trump's tariffs in a blow to his agenda. In a 6-3 decision, the court ruled that he did not have the authority under an economic emergency law to issue such levies. The president responded, saying he would impose a global 10% tariff under a different law. Geoff Bennett spoke with News Hour Supreme Court analyst and SCOTUSBlog co-founder Amy Howe.]]></description>
            <pubDate>Fri, 20 Feb 2026 18:55:11 -0500</pubDate>
            <guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/why-the-supreme-court-ruled-against-trumps-tariffs</guid>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/donald-trump"><![CDATA[Donald Trump news]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/supreme-court"><![CDATA[Supreme Court]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/tariffs"><![CDATA[tariffs]]></category>
                                                        <dc:creator><![CDATA[Geoff Bennett]]></dc:creator>
                                <dc:creator><![CDATA[Ali Schmitz]]></dc:creator>
                                                                <media:content url="https://d3i6fh83elv35t.cloudfront.net/static/2026/02/Tariffs1-1024x664.jpg" medium="image" width="1024" height="664" />
                    </item>
                <item>
            <title><![CDATA[Trump's administration is loaded with people who backed his false 2020 election claims]]></title>
            <link>https://www.pbs.org/newshour/politics/trumps-administration-is-loaded-with-people-who-backed-his-false-2020-election-claims</link>
            <description><![CDATA[President Donald Trump has long spread conspiracy theories  designed to explain away his 2020 election loss. Now that he's president again, Trump has stocked his administration with those who have promoted his falsehoods and in some cases helped him try to overturn his loss.]]></description>
            <pubDate>Fri, 20 Feb 2026 18:50:32 -0500</pubDate>
            <guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.pbs.org/newshour/politics/trumps-administration-is-loaded-with-people-who-backed-his-false-2020-election-claims</guid>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/2020-election"><![CDATA[2020 election]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/donald-trump"><![CDATA[Donald Trump news]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/election-deniers"><![CDATA[election deniers]]></category>
                                                        <dc:creator><![CDATA[Nicholas Riccardi, Associated Press]]></dc:creator>
                                                                <media:content url="https://d3i6fh83elv35t.cloudfront.net/static/2026/02/2026-02-10T211459Z_1977908244_RC2LCHAHAVO9_RTRMADP_3_USA-JUSTICE-JUDGES-1024x683.jpg" medium="image" width="1024" height="683" />
                    </item>
                <item>
            <title><![CDATA[What's next for consumers and the economy after the Supreme Court's tariff ruling]]></title>
            <link>https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/whats-next-for-consumers-and-the-economy-after-the-supreme-courts-tariff-ruling</link>
            <description><![CDATA[After the Supreme Court struck down many of President Trump's global tariffs, he pledged to keep most of them in place through other means. To discuss what the ruling and the president's response mean for the economy, Amna Nawaz spoke with Natasha Sarin, a professor of law and finance at Yale University and president of The Budget Lab at Yale.]]></description>
            <pubDate>Fri, 20 Feb 2026 18:50:25 -0500</pubDate>
            <guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/whats-next-for-consumers-and-the-economy-after-the-supreme-courts-tariff-ruling</guid>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/donald-trump"><![CDATA[Donald Trump news]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/economy"><![CDATA[Economy]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/natasha-sarin"><![CDATA[Natasha Sarin]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/supreme-court"><![CDATA[Supreme Court]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/tariffs"><![CDATA[tariffs]]></category>
                                                        <dc:creator><![CDATA[Amna Nawaz]]></dc:creator>
                                <dc:creator><![CDATA[Jackson Hudgins]]></dc:creator>
                                                                <media:content url="https://d3i6fh83elv35t.cloudfront.net/static/2026/02/Tariffs2-1024x683.jpg" medium="image" width="1024" height="683" />
                    </item>
                <item>
            <title><![CDATA[Business owner who challenged Trump's tariffs reacts to Supreme Court decision]]></title>
            <link>https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/business-owner-who-challenged-trumps-tariffs-reacts-to-supreme-court-decision</link>
            <description><![CDATA[One of the plaintiffs in the Supreme Court case that overturned many of President Trump's tariffs is Rick Woldenberg. He's the owner of the Chicago-based small toy manufacturer, Learning Resources. Woldenberg joined Geoff Bennett to discuss the ruling and what comes next for his business.]]></description>
            <pubDate>Fri, 20 Feb 2026 18:45:19 -0500</pubDate>
            <guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/business-owner-who-challenged-trumps-tariffs-reacts-to-supreme-court-decision</guid>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/donald-trump"><![CDATA[Donald Trump news]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/rick-woldenberg"><![CDATA[Rick Woldenberg]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/supreme-court"><![CDATA[Supreme Court]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/tariffs"><![CDATA[tariffs]]></category>
                                                        <dc:creator><![CDATA[Geoff Bennett]]></dc:creator>
                                <dc:creator><![CDATA[Kyle Midura]]></dc:creator>
                                                                <media:content url="https://d3i6fh83elv35t.cloudfront.net/static/2026/02/Tariffs3-1024x695.jpg" medium="image" width="1024" height="695" />
                    </item>
                <item>
            <title><![CDATA[Olympic freeskier Hunter Hess flashes 'L' sign, says he stands by his statement and loves the USA]]></title>
            <link>https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/olympic-freeskier-hunter-hess-flashes-l-sign-says-he-stands-by-his-statement-and-loves-the-usa</link>
            <description><![CDATA[The 27-year-old American freeskier who received the "loser" label from President Donald Trump at the start of the Olympics — leading to threats to his family and setting off the first major political imbroglio of the Games — explained he has used the entire episode as motivation.]]></description>
            <pubDate>Fri, 20 Feb 2026 18:42:59 -0500</pubDate>
            <guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/olympic-freeskier-hunter-hess-flashes-l-sign-says-he-stands-by-his-statement-and-loves-the-usa</guid>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/2026-winter-olympics"><![CDATA[2026 winter olympics]]></category>
                                                        <dc:creator><![CDATA[Eddie Pells, Associated Press]]></dc:creator>
                                                                <media:content url="https://d3i6fh83elv35t.cloudfront.net/static/2026/02/2026-02-20T125825Z_2036838951_MT1USATODAY28291100_RTRMADP_3_OLYMPICS-FREESTYLE-SKIING-MENS-HALFPIPE-QUALIFICATION-1024x683.jpg" medium="image" width="1024" height="683" />
                    </item>
                <item>
            <title><![CDATA[Trump suggests limited strikes to push Iran to nuclear deal]]></title>
            <link>https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/trump-suggests-limited-strikes-to-push-iran-to-nuclear-deal</link>
            <description><![CDATA[On Friday, President Trump suggested he was considering a limited strike on Iran. The public statements come as the United States continues to deploy a large number of military assets in the region and as Iran's foreign minister said he was drafting a new diplomatic proposal as part of ongoing negotiations. Nick Schifrin reports.]]></description>
            <pubDate>Fri, 20 Feb 2026 18:40:59 -0500</pubDate>
            <guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/trump-suggests-limited-strikes-to-push-iran-to-nuclear-deal</guid>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/donald-trump"><![CDATA[Donald Trump news]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/iran"><![CDATA[Iran]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/iran-nucelar-program"><![CDATA[iran nucelar program]]></category>
                                                        <dc:creator><![CDATA[Nick Schifrin]]></dc:creator>
                                <dc:creator><![CDATA[Amna Nawaz]]></dc:creator>
                                <dc:creator><![CDATA[Dan Sagalyn]]></dc:creator>
                                                                <media:content url="https://d3i6fh83elv35t.cloudfront.net/static/2026/02/OntheBrink-1024x683.jpg" medium="image" width="1024" height="683" />
                    </item>
                <item>
            <title><![CDATA[News Wrap: Ex-prince's former home searched a day after his arrest]]></title>
            <link>https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/news-wrap-ex-princes-former-home-searched-a-day-after-his-arrest</link>
            <description><![CDATA[In our news wrap Friday, police searched the former home of Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor a day after his arrest related to his friendship with Jeffrey Epstein, the Trump administration is requiring all truckers and bus drivers to take commercial driving tests in English and Speaker Mike Johnson's office denied a request for the late Jesse Jackson to lie in honor in the Capitol.]]></description>
            <pubDate>Fri, 20 Feb 2026 18:35:38 -0500</pubDate>
            <guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/news-wrap-ex-princes-former-home-searched-a-day-after-his-arrest</guid>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/news-wrap"><![CDATA[news wrap]]></category>
                                                            <media:content url="https://d3i6fh83elv35t.cloudfront.net/static/2026/02/NewsWrap-16-1024x683.jpg" medium="image" width="1024" height="683" />
                    </item>
                <item>
            <title><![CDATA[EPA rollbacks on pollution limits could drive up health care costs, advocates warn]]></title>
            <link>https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/epa-rollbacks-on-pollution-limits-could-drive-up-health-care-costs-advocates-warn</link>
            <description><![CDATA[The Environmental Protection Agency is moving to scale back limits on toxic emissions from coal-burning power plants, clearing the way for them to emit more hazardous pollutants, such as mercury. Advocates are warning that rolling back limits could harm human health and drive up health care costs. Stephanie Sy discussed more with John Walke of the Natural Resources Defense Council.]]></description>
            <pubDate>Fri, 20 Feb 2026 18:30:42 -0500</pubDate>
            <guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/epa-rollbacks-on-pollution-limits-could-drive-up-health-care-costs-advocates-warn</guid>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/coal"><![CDATA[coal]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/coal-fired-plants"><![CDATA[coal-fired plants]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/emissions"><![CDATA[emissions]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/epa"><![CDATA[EPA]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/mercury"><![CDATA[Mercury]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/natural-resources-defense-council"><![CDATA[natural resources defense council]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/pollution"><![CDATA[pollution]]></category>
                                                        <dc:creator><![CDATA[Stephanie Sy]]></dc:creator>
                                <dc:creator><![CDATA[Azhar Merchant]]></dc:creator>
                                                                <media:content url="https://d3i6fh83elv35t.cloudfront.net/static/2026/02/ChangingRules-1024x683.jpg" medium="image" width="1024" height="683" />
                    </item>
                <item>
            <title><![CDATA[Wyoming Gov. Gordon on tariffs, energy and environmental stewardship]]></title>
            <link>https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/wyoming-gov-gordon-on-tariffs-energy-and-environmental-stewardship</link>
            <description><![CDATA[President Trump welcomed both Democratic and Republican governors to the White House on Friday. As that meeting was underway, the Supreme Court handed down a major ruling against tariffs. The decision could affect a number of states, including Wyoming, where trade and energy production play an important role in the state's economy. Geoff Bennett discussed more with Wyoming Gov. Mark Gordon.]]></description>
            <pubDate>Fri, 20 Feb 2026 18:25:51 -0500</pubDate>
            <guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/wyoming-gov-gordon-on-tariffs-energy-and-environmental-stewardship</guid>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/energy"><![CDATA[energy]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/environment"><![CDATA[Environment]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/mark-gordon"><![CDATA[Mark Gordon]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/tariffs"><![CDATA[tariffs]]></category>
                        <category domain="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/tag/wyoming"><![CDATA[wyoming]]></category>
                                                        <dc:creator><![CDATA[Geoff Bennett]]></dc:creator>
                                <dc:creator><![CDATA[Leila Jackson]]></dc:creator>

                <item>
            <title><![CDATA[Brooks and Capehart on the tariff ruling and Trump's attacks on Supreme Court justices]]></title>
            <link>https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/brooks-and-capehart-on-the-tariff-ruling-and-trumps-attacks-on-supreme-court-justices</link>
            <description><![CDATA[David Brooks of The Atlantic and Jonathan Capehart of MS NOW join Geoff Bennett to discuss the week in politics, including the Supreme Court's tariff ruling, President Trump's attacks on the justices, the first meeting of the Board of Peace and reflections on Rev. Jesse Jackson after his passing.]]></description>

                <item>
            <title><![CDATA[Palestinians in Gaza observe Ramadan despite enormous destruction and loss]]></title>
            <link>https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/palestinians-in-gaza-observe-ramadan-despite-enormous-destruction-and-loss</link>
            <description><![CDATA[The holy month of Ramadan is celebrated by over 1.5 billion Muslims around the world. For Palestinians in Gaza, Ramadan is defined by hope amid destruction and loss. News Hour videographer and producer Shams Odeh spoke with people in Gaza to get a closer feel for their celebrations and sorrows.]]></description>

                <item>
            <title><![CDATA[Mexico and El Salvador make big cocaine seizures at sea as lethal U.S. boat strikes continue]]></title>
            <link>https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/mexico-and-el-salvador-make-big-cocaine-seizures-at-sea-as-lethal-u-s-boat-strikes-continue</link>
            <description><![CDATA[The navies of El Salvador and Mexico announced drug seizures in the Pacific Ocean this week of more than 10 tonnes of cocaine, in contrast to deadly strikes by the U.S. government that just this week left 11 people dead on three boats suspected of carrying drugs in Latin American waters.]]></description>
            <pubDate>Fri, 20 Feb 2026 17:57:12 -0500</pubDate>
            <guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/mexico-and-el-salvador-make-big-cocaine-seizures-at-sea-as-lethal-u-s-boat-strikes-continue</guid>
